Question
column3: Answer

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: To what extent do you support or oppose the widespread deployment of surveillance cameras in public spaces? Please explain your reasoning.
column3: I am against it because It don't trust any government or institution.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What do you think are the most significant impacts, positive or negative, of increasing surveillance camera coverage in urban areas?
column3: Minorities are targeting, government tracks you and sells your data to corporations

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How do you think surveillance technologies might affect public safety and crime rates?
column3: They'll probably go down a little bit.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What impact do you believe increased surveillance might have on personal privacy and individual liberties?
column3: It will negatively impact them a lot.  Government will track you, enter you into databases, stalk you and sell your data to corporations.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How do you think surveillance camera systems might affect community trust and police-community relations?
column3: I think it will erode trust because citizens will feel like they are being watched all the time and that police don't trust them.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What role do you believe government should play in regulating surveillance technologies and data collection?
column3: No data should be sold to governments or businesses.  Data should only be given out by court order.  Make it much harder to collect data about you by everyone.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How might technological concerns about accuracy and reliability factor into decisions about surveillance systems?
column3: Government doesn't care about that.  They only care about power.  Citizens don't care about that or even know about it.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What economic effects, both positive and negative, might result from investing in widespread surveillance infrastructure?
column3: Well the security industry will take off.  Crime might go down a bit and you might have fewer criminals to begin with as people on the margin who might steal something might not if they see a camera.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How do you think the interests of law enforcement versus privacy advocates should be balanced when making surveillance policy?
column3: Privacy advocates should win out everytime.  Don't trust people in power.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What role do you think social equity and potential bias play in discussions about surveillance technologies?
column3: I think only liberals care about that.  It has been shown that minorities are targeted.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How confident are you that changes in Surveillance cameras in public spaces lead to changes in Support for surveillance camera? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It strongly increases support because once you do it, people become used to it and don't think it is a big deal.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What causes changes in Support for surveillance camera? Are these influences strong or weak?
column3: Living in a crime area, being a victim of crime, watching the media focus on the negative, increased diversity all have an effect in increases in surveillance cameras.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Is the effect of Targeting of minorities on Support for surveillance camera immediate, or does it take time to develop? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It is immediate as cops always has minorities and people without power.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Does Crime Rates have a positive or negative effect on Support for surveillance camera, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Crime rates have a high positive effect on support for surveillance cameras.  The higher the crime, the more support.  With little or no crime, it is a high trust community.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Would small changes in Personal privacy lead to noticeable changes in Support for surveillance camera, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Changes in personal privacy leads to a strong positive effect as personal privacy gets lower and lower each year so people just accept surveillance cameras.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Would small changes in Feeling of constant surveillance lead to noticeable changes in Support for surveillance camera, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It would have a strong positive impact of increasing support for surveillance because you'll get used to it and think it is now big deal to accept more of it.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Would small changes in Data privacy lead to noticeable changes in Support for surveillance camera, or would it take larger shifts? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It would probably weakly decrease it since there are almost no laws on data privacy so if we implement some then people might want more privacy.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How would you describe the relationship between Crime Reduction and Support for surveillance camera? Is it a strong or weak connection? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It is strongly positively associated with support for surveillance as they don't care about anything else but crime and punishing people.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Is the effect of Surveillance Policy on Support for surveillance camera immediate, or does it take time to develop? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It is strongly positive and immediate.  Almost anyone can put up a camera and point it anywhere even at someone's house and no one can do anything about it so people will just accept it.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: Does Minority Targeting have a positive or negative effect on Support for surveillance camera, and how significant is this effect? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It has a weak negative effect as the minorities themselves won't like it and liberals won't either.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: What factors affect Distrust in government or institutions, and which ones have the strongest influence? Please also indicate if these influences are positive (increasing) or negative (decreasing).
column3: I would say the media, personal experience and the realities of life all effect distrust in government and institutions.  Also, it is where you are on the status hierarchy. If you are near the top you love society and don't want anyone to take what you have.  If you are at the bottom, you feel targeted and don't want to be harassed all the time.

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How would you describe the relationship between Support for surveillance cameras and Support for surveillance camera? Is it a strong or weak connection? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: Strong positive connection - they are the same thing

session_1747371238721_udtmelr: How confident are you that changes in Immediate effect lead to changes in Support for surveillance camera? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: It is probably strongly positive because if something happens, someone has to do "something" against "those people" so people will throw out civil liberties to feel safe.
